title: Sesame Street gets autistic character
text: Sesame Street gets autistic character, Julia, a friend to Elmo and Abby Cadabby Network Writers News Corp Australia Network Sesame Street gets autistic character, Julia, a friend to Elmo and Abby Cadabby Network Writers News Corp Australia Network Friends ... Sesame Street's new character, Julia, centre, has autism. Picture: Supplied A NEW Muppet has arrived to live on Sesame Street. Julia, a new friend for Elmo, also happens to be on the autism spectrum. Julia was introduced in Sesame Street and Autism: See Amazing in All Children to promote awareness of children suffering withy autism. In the US, one in 68 children has an autism spectrum disorder (ASD), according to a report by the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention. A 2014 report by the CDC estimates that 1 in 42 boys has autism, 4.5 times as many as girls (1 in 189). “Elmo’s daddy told Elmo that Julia has autism,” he says. “So she does things a little differently. Sometimes Elmo talks to Julia using fewer words and says the same thing a few times.” Julia moves to Sesame Street As the group goes on a quest for a snack, Julia places her hand over her ears when inside Hooper’s store. What’s the matter?” asks Abby. Other Stories
